column2: NORTH CAROLINA PERMIT TEST
column4: North Carolina
column6: NC

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text
column6: Answer2 Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. This road sign:
column4: warns drivers that U-turns are not permitted.
column6: is a no-right-turns sign.
column8: warns drivers of a sharp turn left. Drivers should slow their speed and keep to the left.
column10: provides an advance notice of a roundabout.

column2: 2. What does this road sign indicate?
column4: Vehicles turning left must yield to bikes entering a right turn lane.
column6: Drivers have the right of way over bikes turning left.
column8: Motor vehicles entering an exclusive right-turn lane must weave across bicycle traffic in bicycle lanes.

column2: 3. This sign means:
column4: Stay on the main highway if possible
column6: Not enter
column8: The road to the right is for one-way traffic only

column2: 4. This sign warns drivers that:
column4: there is an intersection ahead.
column6: another road enters the highway from the direction shown.
column8: right turns are not allowed.
column10: the road will make a sharp turn to the right.

column2: 5. This road sign means:
column4: Pass only in the right lane
column6: Cars in right lane must slow down
column8: No left turn

column2: 6. This sign is a:
column4: warning sign.
column6: guide sign.
column8: stop sign.

column2: 7. This road sign means:
column4: You must come to a complete stop
column6: Wrong Way
column8: You may proceed at regular speed through the intersection
column10: Slow down and be prepared to stop if necessary

column2: 8. What does the pictured signal indicate?
column4: A pedestrian may begin crossing the street.
column6: A pedestrian may not not begin crossing the street.
column8: Drivers should walk more and drive less.

column2: 9. This road sign means:
column4: Bicycles have the right-of-way
column6: No Bicycle zone
column8: Bicycle repair shop ahead

column2: 10. This sign means:
column4: no turns are allowed on this road.
column6: the road may be slippery when wet.
column8: narrow road ahead.

column2: 11. This road sign means:
column4: Wrong Way
column6: Slow down, slippery when wet
column8: Steep grade ahead

column2: 12. This road sign means:
column4: The road ahead turns sharply right then sharply left
column6: Sharp right turn
column8: Winding road ahead
column10: A road joins from the left

column2: 13. When you reach an intersection with a stop sign, you should:
column4: stop, look right, then left, then right again.
column6: follow the vehicle ahead of you.
column8: check your rearview mirror, look left, then right, then proceed.
column10: stop, look left, then right, then left again.

column2: 14. Before a school bus stops to load passengers, the driver will usually flash:
column4: red warning lights.
column6: yellow warning lights.
column8: red lights.

column2: 15. An emergency vehicle that uses lights and a siren can be unpredictable. Why?
column4: Emergency vehicles must go faster than the posted speed limit when it is safe to do so.
column6: The driver can legally pass red lights.
column8: Emergency vehicle drivers are not required to be careful.

column2: 16. When driving on major highways you should:
column4: stay alert.
column6: be ready to react to road hazards.
column8: keep your eyes moving.

column2: 17. A flashing yellow light means:
column4: Come to a full stop
column6: Pedestrian crossing
column8: Proceed with caution

column2: 18. Your brake lights tell other drivers that you:
column4: are changing lanes.
column6: are slowing down or stopping.
column8: have your emergency brake on.

column2: 19. If you drink alcohol socially, what helps insure safe driving?
column4: Take a cold shower before driving.
column6: Drink coffee before driving.
column8: Ride home with a friend who has not been drinking.
column10: Stop drinking one hour before driving.

column2: 20. BAC is expressed in:
column4: ounces of alcohol in your blood.
column6: percentage of blood to alcohol.
column8: percentage of alcohol to blood.

column2: 21. If you are pulled over by law enforcement, you should:
column4: get out of your vehicle and walk toward the patrol car.
column6: unbuckle your seat belt and lower your window.
column8: turn off on your interior light if stopped at night.
column10: stay in the driver’s seat with both hands clearly in sight on the steering wheel.

column2: 22. If cars approaching from opposite directions reach an intersection at the same time:
column4: a car that moves straight must yield to cars that turn left.
column6: a car that turns right must yield to cars that move straight or turn left.
column8: a car that turns left must yield to cars that move straight or turn right.

column2: 23. When meeting a car with blinding headlights, you should:
column4: look toward the left side of the road.
column6: use your emergency flashers to warn the other driver.
column8: look toward the right side of the road.
column10: dim your lights, then speed up and pass quickly.

column2: 24. At intersections where two or more drivers stop at STOP signs at the same time and they are at right angles:
column4: the driver who was going faster before stopping must yield.
column6: the driver on the right must yield to the driver on the left.
column8: the driver on the left must yield to the driver on the right.
column10: the driver who is late for work has the right-of-way.

column2: 25. Conviction for _____________ carries the highest number of points.
column4: driving without a license
column6: passing a stopped school bus that is unloading children
column8: hit and run with property damage

column2: 26. You may not pass another vehicle on either side of a _______ centerline.
column4: single broken yellow
column6: solid or broken yellow
column8: single broken white

column2: 27. A driver should be extra alert for motorcyclists, bicycles and pedestrians. Why?
column4: They obey specific traffic laws.
column6: They don’t have rearview mirrors.
column8: They are hard to see in traffic.

column2: 28. You go with a group of friends to a social event, and you plan to have a few drinks. You should:
column4: stop drinking several minutes before you intend to leave.
column6: make alcohol the focus of the event.
column8: arrange to ride home with a friend who does not drink.
column10: avoid alternating between drinks with alcohol and drinks without any alcohol.

column2: 29. Are drivers allowed to exceed the speed limit to pass other vehicles?
column4: No.
column6: Yes, but only by 10 MPH or less.
column8: Yes, but only if they drive with caution.

column2: 30. To avoid having to make an emergency stop while driving in traffic, drivers should:
column4: look ahead and maintain a safe following distance.
column6: sound their horn to warn other drivers.
column8: drive in the right lane only.
column10: drive slower than the flow of traffic.

column2: 31. You reach an intersection that is not controlled at the same time as a driver on your right, and both of you prepare to go straight. Who has the right-of-way?
column4: You.
column6: The other driver.
column8: Both.

column2: 32. What should you do if your brakes fail?
column4: Try pumping the brake pedal to increase pressure.
column6: Turn on your cruise control.
column8: Hook your shoe under the pedal and see if you can free it.

column2: 33. To reduce their chances of colliding with an animal, drivers should:
column4: look well down the road and far off to each side.
column6: Slow down when approaching animals that are standing near the road.
column8: scan the sides of the road to watch for the reflection of vehicle headlights in the eyes of animals.

column2: 34. A thumping sound can be a warning:
column4: of a headlight failure.
column6: that a tire blowout is about to occur.
column8: of a brake failure.

column2: 35. You can reduce the chance of a collision with a large vehicle if you:
column4: delay near it.
column6: pay close attention to the turn signals.
column8: pull in front of the large vehicle before you can see the whole front of the vehicle in your mirror.
column10: cut abruptly in front of it.

column2: 36. When you make a left turn from a one-way road into a one-way road, if the road you enter has two lanes, you:
column4: must turn into its left lane.
column6: can not turn left.
column8: must turn into its right lane.
column10: must go to the next intersection.

column2: 37. Drivers can not pass a vehicle on the left if:
column4: they approach a curve on a two-way road and can not see around it.
column6: they can not safely return to the right lane before any oncoming vehicle comes within 200 feet of them.
column8: their lane has a solid yellow center line.
